Description: Fragment of lower body of Milesian Fikellura pottery amphora; white slip; frieze of crescents above two dilute lines; below, band of lotus flower and buds.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 39)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 118, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.066)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4723 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
